Key Match Events: Nikola Jokic recorded a triple-double with 30 points, 11 rebounds, and 14 assists
Post-Match Reflections: The Nuggets have now beaten the Heat in nine straight regular-season meetings, dating back to the COVID-shortened 2020-21 season.
Miami has just one victory inside Ball Arena since the 2016-17 season (Game 2, 2024 NBA Finals).
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jimmy Butler sprained his right ankle in the first quarter and did not return;
The Nuggets stormed out the gates offensively and didnâ€™t look back, shooting 61.7 percent from the floor and 51.4 percent (18-35) from 3-point range.
Tyler Herro led the Heat in scoring once again with 24 points and a team-high 11 dimes
Bam Adebayo had 10 points and nine rebounds while Duncan Robinson tallied 20 points on 6-of-10 shooting from distance.
Others: The Heat have now lost three straight games after losses to Sacramento and Phoenix, dropping to 3-5 on the season and 0-3 against the vaunted Western Conference.
